replies.body: Unranked is the same as silver III...
Uh no its not, its just unranked.
Uh, yes it is, unranked is considered average, and so is Silver III.

As mutley said, 

Unranked can be Bronze - World class.

There is no average in unranked, hence its called unranked.

When you rank up you start with an elo of say 1250 and go from there. you dont have an elo for ranked until you start.

There is a normal elo as below, showing all unranked players are playing Diamonds and challengers.

So, normal has elo for normal,

Ranked has elo, e.g. current rank 1250 elo = Silver 4 (Roughly)

unranked = unranked until they start their placements (New players). The only way you can have an elo and not be ranked is if you didn't complete your placements and soft resets happen for the next season.

You can be considered average if unranked, as norms arn't ranked, they are just norms and alot of players muck around etc.
Wait, I'm confused now. How does the matchmaking system sort unranked players into fair matches if they don't have an elo?

It goes off their normal elo. Not their ranked elo.
Believe it or not, there is a normal game elo separate to a ranked elo.
Thats why you can see a plat or gold player playing against lower ranked players on there own. They have a crap normal game elo compared to their ranked game elo.

So placement matches, start with normal elo, to establish division and ranked elo, then everything else goes as expected?

That's confusing but it makes sense :P

Unranked is Bronze - World Class. Just because they don't have a rank doesn't mean their shit, it just means there not playing League of Legends seriously and there is nothing wrong with playing LoL for fun. (my comment above as a picture look at that)
